result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan D Zettle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryan D Zettle

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Bryan D Zettle in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1. Count 2 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. Count 2 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Bryan D Zettle in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense advises that he needs to go through discovery with Defendant. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Status conference set for March 28, 2016 at 10:00. Bond continues as is.

Defendant Bryan D Zettle in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases

Defendant Bryan D Zettle in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Defendant Bryan D Zettle in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Bryan D Zettle appeared by video conference. Attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers appeared in Court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 1/11/16, 10:00.
